H0.text: A mixture is the term that best describes the contents of the bird feeder, which contains sunflower seeds and corn, used by Betsy to attract a variety of birds to her backyard.

H1.text: A solution is the term that best describes the contents of the bird feeder containing sunflower seeds and corn that Betsy puts up to attract a variety of birds to her backyard.

H2.text: An element is the term that best describes the contents of Betsyâ€™s bird feeder, which contains sunflower seeds and corn and is intended to attract a variety of birds.

H3.text: A compound is the term that best describes the contents of Betsy's bird feeder, which contains sunflower seeds and corn and is intended to attract a variety of birds to her backyard.

A4.text: Mixtures are a material made up of two or more different chemical substances which can be separated by physical method.

A5.text: mixtures have variable compositions, while compounds have a fixed, definite formula.
